thread.title: George Clooney says he and Amal restricting their travels
thread.title_full: George Clooney says he and Amal restricting their travels | Daily Mail Online

author: Paul Chavez For Dailymail.com
title: George Clooney says he and Amal restricting their travels
text:
George Clooney and his pregnant wife Amal have agreed to self-imposed travel restrictions while she's pregnant.
The 55-year-old actor and his 39-year-old human rights lawyer wife earlier this month confirmed they were expecting twins.
The Syriana star told the French publication Paris Match that he and Amal will be more cautious as they expect their first children together.
Travel restrictions: George Clooney, shown in May 2015 in London, told a French publication that he and pregnant wife Amal have self-imposed travel restrictions while she's pregnant
'We decided to be much more responsible, to avoid the danger,' George told the magazine.
'I won't go to South Sudan any more or the Congo, Amal will no longer go to Iraq and she'll avoid places where she knows she isn't welcome,' he said.
Amal as an international human rights lawyer has represented a journalist being held in Egypt and criticized Egypts' judiciary process in a February 2014 report. She's also been to several other international hotspots working on disputes.
Clooney has been a staunch advocate for a resolution of the Darfur conflict in southern Sudan.
International lawyer: Amal, shown Tuesday in London, is an international human rights lawyer who has traveled to dangerous places in the past
Be the lady in red like Amal in Stella McCartney £2014 Stella McCartney Pre-Fall 2017

Amal Clooney was spotted in London this week for the first time since her pregnancy news broke. You could barely catch a glimpse of her bump though under her billowing coat!
The Human Rights Barrister donned a grey dress with tights and boots layered with a maxi length coat by Stella McCartney.
For us regular beings, this coat is not up for grabs right now as it hails from the pre-fall 2017 collection, but you can shop the current line directly at the website (click right).
We love the bold scarlet hue of this outerwear, the large lapels and double breasted finish. Plus, once Amal is no longer pregnant, that belt will nip her in at the waist nicely.
Keen to be the lady in red? Check out some similar alternatives in the line up below from New Look, MSGM and more.

Darfur conflict: George is shown in January 2011 in south Sudan during a referendum in Juba related to the Darfur conflict
Front line: Amal is shown in August 2015 during the trial of an Al Jazeera journalist in Cairo, Egypt
He spent 10 days in Chad and Sudan in April 2006 to produce the TV special A Journey To Darfur that highlighted the plight of refugees.
George also discussed his growing family's plans as they are about to double in size.
'We have the chance to live between three countries: Italy, America and England,' George said in reference to their properties in each country.
Cute couple: George and Amal, shown last month in London, are expecting twins in June
'But as soon as the children go to school, it'll be necessary to choose where to settle. In the meantime, we will continue to move according to our respective schedules,' he said.
He admitted that parenthood was at the forefront of their thoughts.
'How can we not be anxious about this immense responsibility?,' he said.
Going strong: The actor and human rights lawyer, shown in October in Los Angeles, have been married since September 2014
He also nixed tabloid reporting that they were expecting a boy and a girl.
'I don't know where this rumor comes from that we're going to have a boy and a girl. We ourselves don't know yet and don't want to know,' George said.
The actor will receive the prestigious César Award for career achievement Friday during the 42nd César Awards in Paris.
Career honor: George, shown promoting Oceans 12 in June 2004 in Italy, will be honored Friday with the career César Award in Paris
